text:
<@U021H3TV338> I used query parameters all the time. Can use it to test stuff in modules, new blog layouts, all kinds of things.

Example in a module
```{% if request.query_dict.hsDebug %}
module.field2
{% else %} {# no hsDebug #}
module.field
{% endif %} {# if request.query_dict.hsDebug #}```
Example for a new blog
```{% if request.query_dict.hsDebug != true %}
{% include './post-v2.html' %}
{% else %}
{% include './post-v1.html' %}
{% endif %}```

I really like it for blogs. Can have completely different layout and actually test it on a live domain. Just add `?hsDebug=true`  or whatever. I use hsDebug cuz I can add it easily with the Chrome Extension :stuck_out_tongue:
